  "Broker Comment" : "** OTHER RELATED ITEM 22H2 ** U4 RECEIVED FROM RONEY & CO. DISCLOSES THAT ON MAY 14, 1987, JAMES AND GRETCHEN WANTY FILED A COMPLAINT AGAINST HADLER ALLEGING DAMAGES IN THE AMOUNT OF $72,598.58. HADLER STATES THAT THE CLIENTS' ACCOUNT HAD BEEN CLEARED FOR OPTION TRADING AND STRATEGIES. THE OPTION PAPERS WERE ON FILE AT THE MERRILL LYNCH OFFICE, SIGNED BY OPTION PRINCIPAL AND THE OFFICE MANAGER, [OTHER FIRM EMPLOYEE]. AFTER CONVERSATION WITH HIS SUPERIORS, HADLER WAS ADVISED TO GO TO THE CLIENT PERSONALLY AND NEGOTIATE SETTLEMENT. AFTER SEVERAL CONVERSATIONS WITH THE CLIENTS, A SETTLEMENT WAS REACHED ON JUNE 26, 1987, IN THE AMOUNT OF $23,600.00 ($20,000.00 OF WHICH WAS PRESENTED IN CHECK FORM FROM MERRILL LYNCH AND $3,600.00 OF WHICH WAS A DEBIT IN THE CLIENTS' ACCOUNT WHICH WAS FORGIVEN). HADLER FURTHER STATES THAT THE CLIENT LOSSES WERE SUFFERED IN JANUARY AND APRIL OF 1987. IN JANUARY, THE STRATEGIES WERE AGREED UPON BETWEEN HIMSELF AND THE CLIENT. IN APRIL, THE STRATEGIES WERE UNSOLICITED AND WERE ENTERED BY HADLER ON BEHALF OF THE CLIENT. IN A COMPLAINT LETTER FROM WANTY'S ATTORNEY TO HADLER, IT INDICATES THAT THE TRANSACTIONS WHICH HE RECOMMENDED TO THE [CUSTOMER] WERE NOT SUITABLE FOR WANTY AS AN INVESTOR, NOR DID WANTY RECEIVE FULL DISCLOSURE OF MATERIAL INFORMATION RELATIVE TO THE RISKS; AND THAT MERRILL LYNCH DID NOT FULFILL ITS OBLIGATIONS TO PROPERLY SUPERVISE HADLER IN CONNECTION WITH THE TRADES. COPY OF ATTORNEY'S LETTER AND SETTLEMENT RELEASE WERE RECEIVED."
}
